DataElement.preferredName: Arm and Breast Symptom Questionnaire 1 Past 7 Days How Difficult to Push or Pull Large Objects with Affected Arm Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how difficult it has been in the past 7 days to push or pull large objects, like a living room chair, with their affected arm, using a 5-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Arm And Breast Symptom Questionnaire Past Week How Difficult to Push or Pull Large Objects with Affected Arm Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient._Predetermined sets of questions used to collect data - clinical data, social status, occupational group, etc. The term is often applied to a self-completed survey instrument._The most recent week, including today._A question about how difficult it is for an individual to push or pull large objects with their affected arm._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the upper extremity between the shoulder and the elbow. For clinical purposes this term is also used to refer to the whole superior limb.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Difficult to Push or Pull Large Objects with Affected Arm Score

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: How Difficult to Push or Pull Large Objects with Affected Arm
Concepts.definition: A question about how difficult it is for an individual to push or pull large objects with their affected arm.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Arm and Breast Symptom Questionnaire Difficulty 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (not at all difficult) to 5 (Unable to do) on a 5-point Likert scale.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of non-agreement.: Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.
Something not easily done, accomplished, comprehended, or solved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

Concepts.longName: Can Do With a Little Difficulty
Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is able to do something with a little difficulty.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective response indicating that an individual finds something to be somewhat difficult.

Concepts.definition: A subjective response indicating that an individual finds something to be somewhat difficult.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was very difficult.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was very difficult.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
